trans-unit.source: Learn how to use Stream Analytics Management .NET SDK | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use Stream Analytics Management .NET SDK | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Get started with Stream Analytics Management .NET SDK.
trans-unit.target: Get started with Stream Analytics Management .NET SDK.

trans-unit.source: Learn how to set up and run analytics jobs: Create a project, inputs, outputs, and transformations.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to set up and run analytics jobs: Create a project, inputs, outputs, and transformations.

trans-unit.source: Set up and run analytics jobs using the Azure Stream Analytics Management .NET SDK
trans-unit.target: Set up and run analytics jobs using the Azure Stream Analytics Management .NET SDK

trans-unit.source: Learn how to set up an run analytics jobs using the Stream Analytics Management .NET SDK.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to set up an run analytics jobs using the Stream Analytics Management .NET SDK.

trans-unit.source: Set up a project, create input and output sources, transformations, and start and stop jobs.
trans-unit.target: Set up a project, create input and output sources, transformations, and start and stop jobs.

trans-unit.source: For your analytics jobs, you can stream data from Blob storage or from an event hub.
trans-unit.target: For your analytics jobs, you can stream data from Blob storage or from an event hub.

trans-unit.source: Azure Stream Analytics is a fully managed service providing low-latency, highly available, scalable, complex event processing over streaming data in the cloud.
trans-unit.target: Azure Stream Analytics is a fully managed service providing low-latency, highly available, scalable, complex event processing over streaming data in the cloud.

trans-unit.source: Stream Analytics enables customers to set up streaming jobs to analyze data streams, and allows them to drive near real-time analytics.
trans-unit.target: Stream Analytics enables customers to set up streaming jobs to analyze data streams, and allows them to drive near real-time analytics.

trans-unit.source: For the .NET API reference, see [Stream Analytics Management .NET SDK](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn889315.aspx).
trans-unit.target: For the .NET API reference, see [Stream Analytics Management .NET SDK](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn889315.aspx).

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites

trans-unit.source: Before you begin this article, you must have the following:
trans-unit.target: Before you begin this article, you must have the following:

trans-unit.source: Install Visual Studio 2012 or 2013.
trans-unit.target: Install Visual Studio 2012 or 2013.

trans-unit.source: Download and install [Azure .NET SDK](http://azure.microsoft.com/downloads/).
trans-unit.target: Download and install [Azure .NET SDK](http://azure.microsoft.com/downloads/).

trans-unit.source: Create an Azure Resource Group in your subscription.
trans-unit.target: Create an Azure Resource Group in your subscription.

trans-unit.source: The following is a sample Azure PowerShell script.
trans-unit.target: The following is a sample Azure PowerShell script.

trans-unit.source: For Azure PowerShell information, see [Install and configure Azure PowerShell](../install-configure-powershell.md);
trans-unit.target: For Azure PowerShell information, see [Install and configure Azure PowerShell](../install-configure-powershell.md);

trans-unit.source: Set up an input source and output target to use.
trans-unit.target: Set up an input source and output target to use.

trans-unit.source: See [Get Started Using Azure Stream Analytics](stream-analytics-get-started.md) to set up a sample input and/or output to be used by this article.
trans-unit.target: See [Get Started Using Azure Stream Analytics](stream-analytics-get-started.md) to set up a sample input and/or output to be used by this article.

trans-unit.source: Set up a project
trans-unit.target: Set up a project

trans-unit.source: To create an analytics job, first set up your project.
trans-unit.target: To create an analytics job, first set up your project.

trans-unit.source: Create a Visual Studio C# .NET console application.
trans-unit.target: Create a Visual Studio C# .NET console application.

trans-unit.source: In the Package Manager Console, run the following commands to install the NuGet packages.
trans-unit.target: In the Package Manager Console, run the following commands to install the NuGet packages.

trans-unit.source: The first one is the Azure Stream Analytics Management .NET SDK.
trans-unit.target: The first one is the Azure Stream Analytics Management .NET SDK.

trans-unit.source: The second one is the Azure Active Directory client that will be used for authentication.
trans-unit.target: The second one is the Azure Active Directory client that will be used for authentication.

trans-unit.source: Add the following **appSettings** section to the App.config file:
trans-unit.target: Add the following **appSettings** section to the App.config file:

trans-unit.source: Replace values for **SubscriptionId** and **ActiveDirectoryTenantId** with your Azure subscription and tenant IDs.
trans-unit.target: Replace values for **SubscriptionId** and **ActiveDirectoryTenantId** with your Azure subscription and tenant IDs.

trans-unit.source: You can get these values by running the following Azure PowerShell cmdlet:
trans-unit.target: You can get these values by running the following Azure PowerShell cmdlet:

trans-unit.source: Add the following **using** statements to the source file (Program.cs) in the project:
trans-unit.target: Add the following **using** statements to the source file (Program.cs) in the project:

trans-unit.source: Add an authentication helper method:
trans-unit.target: Add an authentication helper method:

trans-unit.source: Create a Stream Analytics management client
trans-unit.target: Create a Stream Analytics management client

trans-unit.source: A **StreamAnalyticsManagementClient** object allows you to manage the job and the job components, such as input, output, and transformation.
trans-unit.target: A **StreamAnalyticsManagementClient** object allows you to manage the job and the job components, such as input, output, and transformation.

trans-unit.source: Add the following code to the beginning of the **Main** method:
trans-unit.target: Add the following code to the beginning of the **Main** method:

trans-unit.source: The **resourceGroupName** variable's value should be the same as the name of the resource group you created or picked in the prerequisite steps.
trans-unit.target: The **resourceGroupName** variable's value should be the same as the name of the resource group you created or picked in the prerequisite steps.

trans-unit.source: The remaining sections of this article assume that this code is at the beginning of the **Main** method.
trans-unit.target: The remaining sections of this article assume that this code is at the beginning of the **Main** method.

trans-unit.source: Create a Stream Analytics job
trans-unit.target: Create a Stream Analytics job

trans-unit.source: The following code creates a Stream Analytics job under the resource group that you have defined.
trans-unit.target: The following code creates a Stream Analytics job under the resource group that you have defined.

trans-unit.source: You will add an input, output, and transformation to the job later.
trans-unit.target: You will add an input, output, and transformation to the job later.

trans-unit.source: Create a Stream Analytics input source
trans-unit.target: Create a Stream Analytics input source

trans-unit.source: The following code creates a Stream Analytics input source with the blob input source type and CSV serialization.
trans-unit.target: The following code creates a Stream Analytics input source with the blob input source type and CSV serialization.

trans-unit.source: To create an event hub input source, use **EventHubStreamInputDataSource** instead of **BlobStreamInputDataSource**.
trans-unit.target: To create an event hub input source, use **EventHubStreamInputDataSource** instead of **BlobStreamInputDataSource**.

trans-unit.source: Similarly, you can customize the serialization type of the input source.
trans-unit.target: Similarly, you can customize the serialization type of the input source.

trans-unit.source: Input sources, whether from Blob storage or an event hub, are tied to a specific job.
trans-unit.target: Input sources, whether from Blob storage or an event hub, are tied to a specific job.

trans-unit.source: To use the same input source for different jobs, you must call the method again and specify a different job name.
trans-unit.target: To use the same input source for different jobs, you must call the method again and specify a different job name.

trans-unit.source: Test a Stream Analytics input source
trans-unit.target: Test a Stream Analytics input source

trans-unit.source: The **TestConnection** method tests whether the Stream Analytics job is able to connect to the input source as well as other aspects specific to the input source type.
trans-unit.target: The **TestConnection** method tests whether the Stream Analytics job is able to connect to the input source as well as other aspects specific to the input source type.

trans-unit.source: For example, in the blob input source you created in an earlier step, the method will check that the Storage account name and key pair can be used to connect to the Storage account as well as check that the specified container exists.
trans-unit.target: For example, in the blob input source you created in an earlier step, the method will check that the Storage account name and key pair can be used to connect to the Storage account as well as check that the specified container exists.

trans-unit.source: Create a Stream Analytics output target
trans-unit.target: Create a Stream Analytics output target

trans-unit.source: Creating an output target is very similar to creating a Stream Analytics input source.
trans-unit.target: Creating an output target is very similar to creating a Stream Analytics input source.

trans-unit.source: Like input sources, output targets are tied to a specific job.
trans-unit.target: Like input sources, output targets are tied to a specific job.

trans-unit.source: To use the same output target for different jobs, you must call the method again and specify a different job name.
trans-unit.target: To use the same output target for different jobs, you must call the method again and specify a different job name.

trans-unit.source: The following code creates an output target (Azure SQL database).
trans-unit.target: The following code creates an output target (Azure SQL database).

trans-unit.source: You can customize the output target's data type and/or serialization type.
trans-unit.target: You can customize the output target's data type and/or serialization type.

trans-unit.source: Test a Stream Analytics output target
trans-unit.target: Test a Stream Analytics output target

trans-unit.source: A Stream Analytics output target also has the **TestConnection** method for testing connections.
trans-unit.target: A Stream Analytics output target also has the **TestConnection** method for testing connections.

trans-unit.source: Create a Stream Analytics transformation
trans-unit.target: Create a Stream Analytics transformation

trans-unit.source: The following code creates a Stream Analytics transformation with the query "select * from Input" and specifies to allocate one streaming unit for the Stream Analytics job.
trans-unit.target: The following code creates a Stream Analytics transformation with the query "select * from Input" and specifies to allocate one streaming unit for the Stream Analytics job.

trans-unit.source: For more information on adjusting streaming units, see [Scale Azure Stream Analytics jobs](stream-analytics-scale-jobs.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information on adjusting streaming units, see [Scale Azure Stream Analytics jobs](stream-analytics-scale-jobs.md).

trans-unit.source: Like input and output, a transformations is also tied to the specific Stream Analytics job it was created under.
trans-unit.target: Like input and output, a transformations is also tied to the specific Stream Analytics job it was created under.

trans-unit.source: Start a Stream Analytics job
trans-unit.target: Start a Stream Analytics job

trans-unit.source: After creating a Stream Analytics job and its input(s), output(s), and transformation, you can start the job by calling the **Start** method.
trans-unit.target: After creating a Stream Analytics job and its input(s), output(s), and transformation, you can start the job by calling the **Start** method.

trans-unit.source: The following sample code starts a Stream Analytics job with a custom output start time set to December 12, 2012, 12:12:12 UTC:
trans-unit.target: The following sample code starts a Stream Analytics job with a custom output start time set to December 12, 2012, 12:12:12 UTC:

trans-unit.source: Stop a Stream Analytics job
trans-unit.target: Stop a Stream Analytics job

trans-unit.source: You can stop a running Stream Analytics job by calling the **Stop** method.
trans-unit.target: You can stop a running Stream Analytics job by calling the **Stop** method.

trans-unit.source: Delete a Stream Analytics job
trans-unit.target: Delete a Stream Analytics job

trans-unit.source: The **Delete** method will delete the job as well as the underlying sub-resources, including input(s), output(s), and transformation of the job.
trans-unit.target: The **Delete** method will delete the job as well as the underlying sub-resources, including input(s), output(s), and transformation of the job.

trans-unit.source: Get support
trans-unit.target: Get support

trans-unit.target: For further assistance, try our [Azure Stream Analytics forum](https://social.msdn.microsoft.com/Forums/en-US/home?forum=AzureStreamAnalytics).
